greeting: Greetings from The On-Line Encyclopedia of Integer Sequences! http://oeis.org/

results.name: a(n) = a((a(n-2))*mod(n,2)+a(n-1)*(1-mod(n,2))) + a((n - a(n-2))*mod(n,2)+(n-a(n-1))*(1-mod(n,2))).
comment: Let M = A005229, C = A004001. Then we may define a pair of new sequences by o1 = M*mod(n,2)+C*(1-mod(n,2)) (this sequence), o2 = C*mod(n,2)+M*(1-mod(n,2)) (A086525 - or is it A086335?).
mathematica: digits = 200 Mc[n_Integer?Positive] := Mc[n] = Mc[( Mc[n-2])*(Mod[n, 2])+Mc[n-1]*(1-Mod[n, 2])] + Mc[(n - Mc[n-2])*(Mod[n, 2])+(n-Mc[n-1])*(1-Mod[n, 2])] Mc[1] = Mc[2] = 1 a1=Table[Mc[n], {n, 1, digits}]
results.author: _Roger L. Bagula_, Sep 15 2003
ext: Edited by _N. J. A. Sloane_, Nov 07 2007
